intro: Klasea cretica, commonly known as the Cretan klasea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are typically finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Klasea cretica thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
